keywords.value: MAZZEO, ALBERTO DANIEL DIED PEACEFULLY AT CALVARY HOSPITAL IN THE BRONX ON JANUARY 29, 2016 AFTER A YEAR, LONG ILLNESS. HE HAD THE CONSTANT AND LOVING SUPPORT OF HIS SPOUSE MITCH MONDELLO, NEIGHBORS, FRIENDS, UN COLLEAGUES AND FAMILY IN ARGENTINA AND ITALY. ALBERTO'S GENEROSITY OF SPIRIT, COURAGE AND OPTIMISM WAS EXEMPLIFIED BY HIS ANSWER WHENEVER ANYONE ASKED HIM HOW HE WAS: "I'M OK, I'M GETTING BETTER." AND OF COURSE BY HIS EXUBERANT LAUGHTER AND LOVE OF MALBEC. IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALBERTO'S WISHES, HIS ASHES WILL BE SCATTERED IN THE HUDSON RIVER AND THE RIO DE LA PLATA, THE RIVERS FLOWING THROUGH THE TWO CITIES THAT HE CONSIDERED HOME. A MEMORIAL MASS AND INTERMENT WILL TAKE PLACE IN ZACCANOPOLI, HIS ANCESTRAL HOME IN CALABRIA. 1

lead_paragraph: MAZZEO--Alberto Daniel Died peacefully at Calvary Hospital in The Bronx on January 29, 2016 after a year-long illness. He had the constant and loving support of his spouse Mitch Mondello, neighbors, friends, UN colleagues and family in Argentina and Italy. Alberto's generosity of spirit, courage and optimism was exemplified by his answer whenever anyone asked him how he was: "I'm OK, I'm getting better." And of course by his exuberant laughter and love of Malbec. In accordance with Alberto's wishes, his ashes will be scattered in the Hudson River and the Rio de la Plata, the rivers flowing through the two cities that he considered home. A memorial Mass and Interment will take place in Zaccanopoli, his ancestral home in Calabria. 1
